intro: Gilia bridgesii, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers that are often pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has hairy, glandular leaves and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gilia bridgesii is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in disturbed areas.
